entries.title: Finding My Voice Again
entries.content: It had been three months of silence. Not the comfortable kind.

passages.text: I stood at the edge of the stage and for the first time in years the words came without effort. Like water finding its level.

storyPrompts.contextBefore: Three months of creative block and silence
storyPrompts.contextAfter: The audience was quiet — but it was a listening quiet

entries.title: The Reunion
entries.content: My sister and I hadn't spoken in four years. Then there she was at the door.

passages.text: The moment I saw her face at the door, time collapsed. All those years folded into this single breath.

storyPrompts.contextBefore: Four years of estrangement and missed calls
storyPrompts.contextAfter: We hugged for the first time in a decade

entries.title: The Grief
entries.content: Today the grief came back without warning. Like a tide I thought had gone out.

passages.text: It arrived in a supermarket aisle — the smell of the bread he used to buy. I stood there holding a basket and just let the wave break.

storyPrompts.visualMetaphor: a wave breaking in a quiet aisle
storyPrompts.contextAfter: I sat in the car for twenty minutes before driving home

entries.title: Small Joy
entries.content: Nothing happened today. Which is why I'm writing it down.

passages.text: Coffee on the balcony. A bird I couldn't name. The city below going about its morning. I felt — for the first time in a long time — simply here.

storyPrompts.contextAfter: I stayed out there for an hour and didn't check my phone
